title: Francis Banville
text: I am a PhD candidate in ecology based in Montreal, Quebec (also known as the bonjour-hi city). I study complex systems such as food webs and other ecological networks using mathematical and probabilistic models. Specifically, I predict the structure of aquatic and terrestrial food webs on a global scale using entropy to better understand what drives trophic interactions at the community level. Considering that winter temperature can be as low as -30 °C in Montreal, my research interests in maximizing the entropy of ecological networks could stem from repressed feelings and desires for warmth.

title: Francis Banville
text:
Education

PhD in Biological Sciences (ongoing) | Université de Montréal and Université de Sherbrooke
BSc in Biological Sciences (2016-18) | Université de Montréal

title: Francis Banville
text:
Experience

Teaching assistant (2020 - present) | Université de Montréal, Département de sciences biologiques (Biostatistics and Population dynamics courses)
Programming mentor (2020-22) | Institute for Data Valorization (IVADO), Data.Trek training program
Research assistant (2021) | Group on Earth Observations Biodiversity Observation Network (GEO BON)
